error.regex: Loading chunk \d+ failed|ChunkLoadError|Failed to fetch dynamically imported module|lazy.*init.*failed|React\.lazy.*factory.*rejected

verdict.summary: React.lazy() dynamic import failed because the chunk file is not available. Common after deployments that change chunk hashes, network failures, or incorrect publicPath configuration.

dead_ends.action: Disable code splitting entirely to avoid chunk loading
dead_ends.why_fails: Results in a single massive bundle, destroying load performance. Does not fix the underlying deployment or CDN issue.

dead_ends.action: Add aggressive caching headers to chunk files
dead_ends.why_fails: Caching old chunks worsens the problem after deployments; users get stale chunks that reference other stale chunks

workarounds.action: Wrap React.lazy components in an Error Boundary that retries or reloads the page
workarounds.how: Catch the ChunkLoadError in an Error Boundary and call window.location.reload() or retry the import: const LazyComp = React.lazy(() => import('./Comp').catch(() => import('./Comp')));

workarounds.action: Ensure old chunks remain available after deployment (keep previous build artifacts on CDN)
workarounds.how: Configure deployment to retain previous build outputs for at least 24 hours. In AWS S3/CloudFront: do not delete old files on deploy. In Vercel/Netlify: this is handled automatically.

leads_to.condition: When the chunk load error is not caught by a Suspense or Error Boundary and crashes the app

preceded_by.condition: When React.lazy is used without a Suspense boundary, and the import fails during the loading phase

frequently_confused_with.distinction: lazy-loading-failed is a network/deployment error about missing JS chunks, while minified-react-error is about React's own error messages being minified in production builds
